be born.translation[0].definitions[0].de: when a person or animal is born, they come out of their mother’s body or out of an egg
be born.translation[0].definitions[0].no: Australian/French etc born (=born in or as a citizen of Australia etc)
be born.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Forty lambs were born this spring.
I was born and raised  (=was born and grew up) in Alabama.
Then, most babies were born at home.
One third of all children are born into single-parent families.
Jenny was born with a small hole in her heart.
be born.translation[1].definitions[0].de: something that is born starts to exist
be born.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: the country where the sport of cricket was born
The alliance was born of necessity in 1941.
Bill spoke with a cynicism born of bitter experience.
